subject: p18767957
History: Year old man with HIV, ESRD on HD presented with cough, fever, hypoxia to 80s, pulmonary edema, Reevaluate lungs for evidence of infection including PJP after volume removal in HD.
Impression: Heart size is upper limits of normal. There has been improvement of the pulmonary edema. There remains vague opacities at the lung bases. This may be due to resolving pulmonary edema versus atelectasis versus residual infiltrate. There are no pneumothoraces.
